    • addToHand

      public boolean addToHand​(LeaderCard leaderCard) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a leaderCard to a Player's hand
      Parameters:
      leaderCard - is the drawn card
      Returns:
      true if it can be added
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      public boolean discardFromHand​(LeaderCard leaderCard) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Discards a leaderCard from a Player's hand
      Parameters:
      leaderCard - is the discarded leaderCard
      Returns:
      true if it can be discarded
      Throws:

      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if it can be removed

    • canBuy

      public boolean canBuy​(DevelopmentCard developmentCard)
      Tells the controller if the user has selected the right quantity of resources in order to buy one development card
      Parameters:
      developmentCard - it's the selected card (it's a list of resourceContainer)
      Returns:
      true if the selected resources are equals to the card's price

    • buy

      public boolean buy()
      Called when canBuy() returns true
      Subtracts all buffers from all the deposits and the vault in order to buy one development card
      Returns:
      true if the subtraction is successful

    • insertBoughtCardOn

      public boolean insertBoughtCardOn​(int id, DevelopmentCard developmentCard)
      Inserts the just bought card into the selected production slot
      Parameters:
      id - is the index of the selected ProductionSlot
      developmentCard - is the card bought by the user
      Returns:
      true if the insert is successful

    • emptyBuffers

      public boolean emptyBuffers()
      Clears all the buffers when the selected resources are wrong and we have to cancel the payment

    • canConvert

      public ConversionMode canConvert()
      canConvert checks if and how many conversions are available
      Returns:
      INACTIVE if the player has no active conversion leader
      AUTOMATIC if he has only one active conversion leader
      CHOICE REQUIRED if he has two conversion leader

    • convert

      public boolean convert​(java.util.ArrayList<ResourceContainer> marketOutput)
      Method called for conversion when there's only one a single conversion available, thus no choice by the user is needed.
      Returns:
      The converted input array

    • fillProductionBuffers

      public boolean fillProductionBuffers​(java.util.ArrayList<ProductionSlot> selectedProductionCards)
      Puts all the resources needed to activate the selected production cards and all the resources produced by those cards into a buffer
      Parameters:
      selectedProductionCards - is the list of the cards selected by the user

    • hasEnoughResourcesForProduction

      public boolean hasEnoughResourcesForProduction()
      Checks if the user has enough resources altogether before the user starts to selected them (vault + deposit) in order to activate the production
      Returns:
      true if he has enough total resources

    • canProduce

      public boolean canProduce​(java.util.ArrayList<ResourceContainer> selectedResources) throws NotEnoughResources, DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded
      Checks if the selected resources are equal to the ones needed to produce
      Parameters:
      selectedResources - is the list of resources selected by the user
      Returns:
      true if he can produce the previously selected cards
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResources - if the user has not enough resources
      DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded - if the user selected too many resources

    • canProduce

      public boolean canProduce() throws NotEnoughResources, DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded
      Checks if the resources selected before and now present in the buffers are equal to the ones needed to produce
      Returns:
      true if he can produce the previously selected cards
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResources - if the user has not enough resources
      DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded - if the user selected too many resources

    • produce

      public boolean produce()
      Called after canProduce()
      Execute the production

    • hasEnoughResources

      public boolean hasEnoughResources​(ResourceContainer requested)
      Uses the current quantity of the single requested ResourceContainer (sum of deposit and vault)
      Returns:
      true if the user has enough resources

    • hasEnoughResources

      public boolean hasEnoughResources​(java.util.ArrayList<ResourceContainer> requested)
      Returns the current quantity of the requested ArrayList of resources (sum of deposit and vault)
      Returns:
      true if the user has enough resources

    • hasEnoughResources

      public boolean hasEnoughResources​(java.util.HashMap<ResourceType,​ResourceContainer> requested)
      Parameters:
      requested - is the current amount of resources in deposit and vault put into a map
      Returns:
      true if the user has enough resources

    • canRemoveFromVault

      public boolean canRemoveFromVault​(ResourceContainer inputContainer) throws NotEnoughResources
      Checks if a specific element inside of inputArr is present in the HashMap and if they can be subtracted
      If everything goes right the element is added bufferArr
      Returns:
      true if the ResourceType of inputContainer is present as a Key and if the quantity can be removed
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResources - if it doesn't contain a specific ResourceType OR if it doesn't contain enough resources of that specific ResourceType

    • canRemoveFromVault

      public boolean canRemoveFromVault​(java.util.ArrayList<ResourceContainer> inputArr) throws NotEnoughResources
      Checks if a series of elements inside of inputArr is present in the HashMap and if they can be subtracted
      if everything goes right bufferMap is put "=" to inputArr
      Parameters:
      inputArr - is an array of ResourceContainer. It contains a list of elements
      (they must be different from each other) and we need to check if they are in the Vault
      Returns:
      true if the elements in inputArr are present in the HashMap
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResources - if it doesn't contain a specific ResourceType OR if it doesn't contain enough resources of that specific ResourceType
